Effect of Amendments

D.C. Law 19-169, in subsec. (b), substituted "residents who use wheelchairs" for "wheelchair-bound residents" and "residents who use wheelchairs" for "residents who are wheel-chair bound".

Legislative History of Laws

For Law 13-127, see notes following § 44-101.01.

For history of Law 19-169, see notes under § 44-102.01.

DC CODE § 44-110.03

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: An ALR shall ensure that the exterior of its facility, including walkways, yards, porches, chimney, gutters, downspouts, paintable surfaces, and accessory buildings are maintained structurally sound, sanitary, and in good repair.

An ALR that provides services to residents who use wheelchairs, shall make reasonable accommodations to render the ALR accessible to residents who use wheelchairs through the installation of a chair lift, curbcuts, an exterior ramp, or like accommodations.
